thread.title: Why the White House worries about trade deficits, from Peter Navarro - Wall Street Journal
thread.title_full: Why the White House worries about trade deficits, from Peter Navarro - Wall Street Journal

title: Why the White House worries about trade deficits, from Peter Navarro - Wall Street Journal
text:
Why the White House Worries About Trade Deficits An imbalance imperils economic growth—and could put U.S. national security in jeopardy. By Peter Navarro Updated March 5, 2017 6:21 p.m. ET 
Do trade deficits matter? The question is important because America’s trade deficit in goods is large and persistent, about $2 billion every day. 
The economic argument that trade deficits matter begins with the observation that growth in real GDP depends on only four factors: consumption, government spending, business investment and net exports (the difference between exports and imports).
